name: Hotel SAINT-JACQUES

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to mixed reviews on TA, I was a little bit worried before I got to St. Jacques, but I found it a very nice and little hotel which offers a good value.
reviews.title: Good value in Latin Quarter

likes.liked: — The view from the balcony and the location
likes.disliked: — Maybe the elevator? Small and old - very normal in Europe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 6 on the second floor for three nights. The room was spacious, clean and tastefully decorated with a balcony facing rue de Ecoles. Different from other reviewers, we had no problem with street noise. Instead, noise from other rooms was quite loud, but we didn't consider it as a problem, since we had similar experiences in most of the acommodations located in old buildings. The bathroom was also spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The staffs were kind and helpful. Especially the young lady at the front desk was really patient with so many questions and requests of the guests, and always helped us with a big smile.
reviews.title: Toute Suite!

likes.disliked: — Repair work in hallways , not noisy, but reveals signs of age & disrepare

reviews.text: The location is excellent. It's a perfect base to hang around Latin Quarter, as well as to explore other arrondissement. After a short walk, you can reach Maubert-Mutualite station or Cluny - La Sorbonne (line 10).
reviews.title: A Nice Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, our stay here was comfortable and satisfactory.
reviews.title: Charming and quaint!
Really pleased with this little jewel
reviews.text: I was very pleased with this hotel. Our room(3) was spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in.

The location is handy for everywhere-the metro is a five minute walk away. Staff very pleasant. Its more like a family bed and breakfast and I mean that as a compliment. You walk in and feel immediately at home. Try the restaurant next door( left and across street its lovely )
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel St Jacques for one night and thought it was a lovely little place to stay. I had the superior double room which had a King (or King Queen) bed, nice paintwork, clean bathroom and nice little balcony overlooking the street on the 5th floor.
reviews.title: Shabby and disappointing

likes.liked: — the location in the Latin Quarter

reviews.text: Only 5 min (if that) walk to the RER and Metro stations and a short stroll to St Germain Blvd.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

likes.disliked: — There is nothing I didn't like!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast room is sweet with nice paintwork. I got a free continental breakfast with the 'winter special' deal and it was very nice.
reviews.title: perfect stay for a couple in paris

likes.liked: — close to the river seine, close to the notre dame, great breakfast, clean and nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on the 29th of April for a 4 night stay. I had booked a superior room and we were given room 16 on the 4th floor which had two lovely large windows but no balcony. The room wasn't too poky but I have to admit that I'd been expecting it to be larger and pleased we weren't in a standard. I think it had been bigger at one point as the fresco on the ceiling alluded to this but it looked like at some point they'd bit into the main room to add the en-suite.
reviews.title: Great location, shame about the noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location (and main selling point) is great - it's so easy to get to from the airport (RER to ND Saint Michel then a 5 minute walk along Boulevard Saint Germain, right into rue St Jaques, left into rue des Ecoles), it's 3 minutes to a metro stop and so convenient for walking to Pantheon and Notre Dame and proved a great base for us to explore the city.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with a previous reviewer that the street is noisy and for many this will be a problem. Certainly if you are a light sleeper forget about staying here. I'd say that I had one good night's sleep whilst I was there and bear in mind, that was after full days of sightseeing and wearing earplugs each night!
reviews.title: room 11
A Fabulous Value Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: The bed was a good size and reasonably comfortable but I confess that I hated the long sausage like pillow that you both had to share, it was neither comfortable or practical. Thankfully there are spare 'proper' pillows in the wardrobe. Also in the wardrobe you'll find a safe.

The bathroom was a decent size and the shower was actually OK - unlike others we had no problems with it during our stay. We found it easier to get the temperature right before you hung it up. It was definitely a 2 star bathroom, by upgrading from standard I thought it might be slightly more 'comfortable' but it was a bit dated around the edges and the complimentary toiletries basic. Towels were changed daily.
reviews.title: A reasonable hotel with good staff but probably not a place we'd return to
Unprofessional receptionist!
reviews.text: The hotel is actually lovely settled at the borders of the Latin District.

reviews.title: Perfect price for a perfect stay!
reviews.text: The building and the rooms are of course hold-fashioned, but clean and spacious enough for a young couple.

We didn't experience the breakfast, but the only, great problem was the receptionist (we mean the French one, not his immigrated collegue, much kinder), who couldn't speak English and -much worse- dramatically showed his disappointment at each sentence he couldn't understand, as if it was our fault...
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.disliked: — outside noise, lights from street at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were spectators of similar scenes, with strange and funny faces from his side, with some guests from the States, whose pronunciation is supposed to be better than ours.
reviews.title: perfect hotel for a romantic w/end in paris

reviews.text: Furthermore, he forgot to give us the receipt of our payment, which I needed for the refund from my company, and pretended he couldn't print a copy.
reviews.title: Great Location

description: The Saint-Jacques Hotel welcomes you in its elegant 19th century building.You will discover its style staircase, its frescoes and its spacious rooms with molded ceilings and for some of them viewing Notre-Dame or with balcony.For an original drink, you can try an Absinthe tasting proposed by ourbar Le Toulouse-Lautrec.
